page.title: 03The Lambton Family.
page.content: { The Lambton Family}no longer lives at Lambton Castle but at{Biddick Hall. They also spend a large part of their time in Italy.The Hall contains the painting{"The Red Boy"}whose jacket was originally yellow but later changed.This work of art is said to be worth one quarter of a million pounds. The child in the picture is one of the present Lord Lambton's ancestors.Some of the other family heirlooms have also been transported from the Castle to other homes.The Castle is not open to the public but at one time there was a Safari Park in the grounds. With the exception of the eldest, Lord Lambton's daughters were educated at Sunderland Church High School.On July 11th 1985{Lucinda Lambton presented the programme "On the Throne" for{BBC Television.
